reviewText:
I haven't seen these films beyond the trailers yet however I wanted to comment on the packaging which I found to be a bit odd. All 3 DVD's were stacked one on top of the other in a single large hub. Very strange indeed. All 3 features are in color and have English subtitles available..

Man from Colorado is 1:33 with the folowing trailers playing before the movie starts. Gilda, Silverado, Bridge On The River Kwai. It should be possible to skip these by using your meny botton on the remote but I didn't try that. You can view the trailers from the special features menu if you wish to.

The Man From Laramie is 2:35 & goes directly to the main menu. You will find the trailer in the special features menu. There are no other trailers on this disc. There is an audio menu with a choice of the original 3 channel sound for a Dolby Digital system or 2 channel stereo.

Man In The Saddle is 1:33 and also goes directly to the main menu. The special features menu plays the following trailers. Silverado, The Professionals, Major Dundee, Glory, and then a compilation trailer for several western movies. 3 movies for $14.99 to me was a good deal & I'll be playing all 3 soon.
I bought this film because I wanted to see The man from Laramie. but I couldn't play it on my DVD player. So I couldn't see the film. Do I get my money back ?
This dvd with 3 great westerns is from the "studio's" and with Jimmy Stewart, Randolph Scott and Glen Ford starring in each movie your getting great acting and stories.
great westerns
will watch again, great dvds, love Randolph Scott. He is in top 3 for westerns.
Great - Awesome!
Good movies
James Stewart & Randolph Scott are 2 of my favorite western actors. Love these two movies.

This is a great collection of Westerns starring: James Stewart, Glenn Ford, Randolph Scott and William Holden. All three movies have their own disk with no double sided disks and all movies are Closed Caption. Only "The Man from Laramie" is in Widescreen format and all movies are in color. "The Man from Colorado" runs for about 98mins (1hr 38mins) and has English (audio & subtitles) with Japanese subtitles. "Man in the Saddle" runs for about 87mins (1hr 27mins) and has English (audio & subtitles) with Japanese subtitles. "The Man from Laramie" runs for about 104mins (1hr 44mins) and has English (audio & subtitles) with French,Portuguese, Chinese, Korean, Thai (subtitles) and Spanish (audio & subtitles). This collection also stars: Arthur Kennedy, Joan Leslie, Ellen Drew, Edgar Buchanan, Donald Crisp, plus others! Overall this is a great collection and I would recommend it if you don't already have these films.

Not the best westerns ever made, but good for a lazy rainy afternoon.

Buy used.

Each western by itself is a good western. Packaged as 3 different westerns for $10 (what I paid) is what gets it a 5 star. Man from Colorado, a dark western in what can go wrong in a Civil War veteran. Man from Laramie, a strong Stewart western (best of the 3 and filmed at 2:35 to boot). Man in the Saddle, better then the typical Scott western.
Great

Very fine looking triple set, but why not use DL discs -- the HD remaster was kind of wasted this way.  Really got it for The Man From Laramie and consider the other 2 features freebies (and not bad at that)
Great product!
Did not receive triple feature instead got double feature Desperatoes and Man from laramie. Will keep it an away but disappointed. Would cost more to ship it back.
So good!
Two of the best cowboy actors love it.

good movie fast delivery
Three great movies with great stars, William Holden, Glenn Ford, Jimmy Stewart and Randolph Scott! If you love westerners you can't go wrong with this one.
